topic: Java Objects and the Execution Model
question: Which of the following statements is/are correct?

options.A: Return value link points to the start of the previous activation record.
options.B: An activation record gets pushed into the stack when a function is called, and popped out when the function returns.
options.C: The variables present in every activation record in the stack are in scope and are accessible.
options.D: The variables present in the topmost activation record of the stack are in scope and are accessible.

question: Which of the following statements is/are true about activation records?

options.A: All the variables on the stack (in any activation record) are said to be in scope.
options.B: The lifetime of a variable is the duration that it spends in the topmost activation record in the stack.
options.C: Every activation record has a control link that points to start of previous record.
options.D: Every activation record has a return value link that points to where to store return value.

options.B: Programmer is not a valid subtype of Senior Programmer because it lacks the method reviewCode()
options.C: Subtyping allows SeniorProgrammer to be used wherever a Programmer is expected.
options.D: Subtyping allows Programmer to be used wherever a SeniorProgrammer is expected.
